Description: Shoulder sherd of Attic black-figured pottery neck-amphora; exterior: traces of band of tongues above black-figure decoration consisting of two confronted heads (woman on left, male on right).
Producer name: Attributed to the Circle of: Lydos
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Dr David George Hogarth
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Ashmolean Museum, Oxford. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Venit 1982 / Painted Pottery from the Greek Mainland found in Egypt, 640-450 BC (p. 234, no. B102)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0030) (Phase 1)
CVA Oxford II / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum Great Britain 9 Oxford fasicule 2 (p. 92, pl. I, no. 34)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Ashmolean Museum, University of Oxford
